result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley C. CARBON was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Bradley C. CARBON is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Bradley C. CARBON was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Manitowoc County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradley C. CARBON

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: All records scanned and verified.
Judgment and NOC returned as "NO SUCH NUMBER"
Final Notice returned as "NO SUCH NUMBER"
Reminder Notice - Final Notice
Judgment of Conviction Sentence to Jail.  Duplicate original delivered to Sheriff.

Count 2 - Disorderly Conduct (DVO) - Guilty plea.  Convicted.  State moves to dismiss count 1, 2nd degree recklessly endangering safety.  Motion granted.  Defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for ten (10) days, under the Huber Law, to commence on 12-18-14 by 8:00 a.m.  Defendant is given credit for six (6) days time already served.  
$543.00 court costs imposed, to be paid by 02-05-15 or 1 day jail.   $500.00 cash bail to be applied.  
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  
Minutes.
Plea hearing is set for 12-05-14 at 11:30 a.m.

The parties are asking for a trial date.  
Jury trial set for 11-13-14 at 8:30 a.m.  Position No. 4
Pre-trial conference set for 11-10-14 at 10:00 a.m.  
Minutes
Plea Date scheduled for 10-02-2014 @ 10:30 a.m. BR-3.

Order Modifying Bail Bond.
The Court hereby orders that the defendant's bail be modified to remove the strict no contact provision between defendant and Amanda Carbon and her residence and replace it with  a no assaultive contact provison between defendant and Amanda Carbon.  Further, defendant must provide proof to the D.A.'s office that arrangements have been made for counseling, as well as verification from the counselor of on going counseling sessions at the frequency to be set by the counselor.  If this proof is not provided, the no assaultive contact provision will revert back to a strict no contact provision.

ADDRESS INFO for Bradley C. CARBON
Current: 828 25th Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States  (Effective: 08-12-2014)
Prior: 1138 S. 39th Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States

MOTION TO MODIFY BOND - 
Testimony presented.
The Court comments and modifies the conditions of bail to no assaultive contact with Amanda Carbon.  The Court also adds a condition that the defendant must provide proof to the D.A'.s office of on-going marriage counseling.
Defense counsel to draft the order.
Amended Cash Bail bond executed.
Minutes.
Motion hearing is set for 08-12-14 at 9:00 a.m.

Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bond.
Cover letter.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.  
ARRAIGNMENT 
Defendant files a Request for Substitution of Judge.   
Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 08-22-14 at 1:30 p.m.   State's Motion and Demand for Discovery. 
Minutes.
Anthony Lambrecht, Public Defender.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 07-16-14 at 2:15 p.m.  
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 2nd degree recklessly endangering safety and disorderly conduct.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 07-07-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $500.00 cash with the conditions that he report to the Two Rivers City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release, that he no possess any dangerous weapons and that he have no contact with Amanda Carbon or her residence located at 3112 Jackson Street, Two Rivers, WI or with any residence she may occupy.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Notice of Party Furnishing Cash Bail.
Minutes.
RE:  Amanda Carbon, on 06-27-14.
